H0.text: Producer and consumer are the categories that describe an organism that eats grass and is preyed upon by a carnivore.

H1.text: Consumer and herbivore are the categories that describe an organism that eats grass and is preyed upon by a carnivore.

H2.text: Decomposer and producer are the categories that describe an organism that eats grass and is preyed upon by a carnivore.

H3.text: Herbivore and decomposer are the categories that describe an organism that eats grass and is preyed upon by a carnivore.

A4.text: Heterotrophs release carbon dioxide (CO2) into the atmosphere through respiration, contributing to a large portion of carbon dioxide emissions.

A5.text: By decomposing dead organic matter, they release essential elements like phosphorus through dephosphorylation, making these nutrients available for other organisms.
